content.question: Which of the following is the solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, y times cosine x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="y of, open parenthesis, pi over 2, close parenthesis, equals e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, cosine x, plus e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="3.0ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, e raised to the cosine x, plus 1, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, e times, sine x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>e</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo largeop="true">⋅</mo></mrow></mstyle><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, e raised to the sine x, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, e raised to the sine x, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

topic.text: 7.6: Finding General Solutions Using Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
